Package com.ibm.streams.operator

Interface Type

All Known Subinterfaces:
BoundedType, CollectionType, CompositeType, EnumType, MapType, OptionalType, TupleType, XMLType
public interface Type
Describes a specific type within a StreamSchema and its representation within Java.

      String getLanguageType()
      Returns the type name as it appears in SPL.

    • getObjectType

      Class<?> getObjectType()
      Get the type of the object returned for this type from a generic object based getter.
      Returns:
      Java Class reference describing the type.
      See Also:
      • Tuple.getObject(int)

    • getAsCompositeElementType

      Class<?> getAsCompositeElementType()
      Get the type of the object returned for this type when stored in a composite type.
      Returns:
      Class of type when stored in a composite type.

    • getDefaultValue

      Object getDefaultValue()
      Get an object that represents the default initial value for this type. For numeric values this corresponds to zero, for string values the empty string and for collections an empty collection. For optional types, the default value is null.
      Returns:
      Default value for this type.

    • randomValue

      Object randomValue(Random rand)
      Return a randomly generated value for testing.
      Parameters:
      rand - Random object used to generate value.
      Returns:
      A random value valid for this type

    • toString

      String toString(Object value)
      Returns a string that textually represents a value of this type, typically using Object.toString() of getObjectType(). The returned value is not always the same as SPL character encoding for the type, specifically:
      • USTRING and RSTRING attributes return the corresponding Java String value, not an SPL string literal with escaped values.
      • XML attributes return the corresponding Java String value, not an SPL XML literal with escaped values and suffix x.
      • OPTIONAL attributes return the corresponding Java String value, if present, or the string "null", if not present.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to be represented as a String.
      Returns:
      String that textually represents value.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - value is not an instance of getObjectType().
      See Also:
      • Tuple.getString(int)
